author: IGN
description:
In today's Daily Fix:
Fresh off the success of the Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater remake, Konami is polling fans (Japan for now) for their thoughts on the next Metal Gear remake. The poll includes the original two Metal Gear games from the '80s, and the remaining Metal Gear Solid console games, including Peacewalker. We're running our own poll at IGN.com, so let us know which Metal Gear game deserves the remake treatment. In other news, more details about the cancelled Perfect Dark reboot have emerged, and at one point, the developers were considering making it an episodic game. Unfortunately, we'll never know how that would've turned out because developer The Initiative has been shuttered and the project canned earlier this year. And finally, there's one Borderlands 4 bug that fans DON'T want patched out: a 'cricket jumping' glitch that lets players skip large sections of the map.

#IGN #DailyFix
title: Konami Wants You to Help Pick the Next Metal Gear Remake - IGN Daily Fix

author: IGN
description:
Hollow Knight: Silksong has four simple keys and four specially locked doors that hide a variety of discoveries. If you found a few and already used them, don’t worry: this guide will help you find and use them all. There’s no right or wrong way to do it, as long as you find all four! Here's how to find all simple keys and simple locks in Silksong.

Timecodes:
0:00 - Intro
0:20 - Simple Key #1 - Bone Bottom
0:40 - Simple Key #2 - Sinner’s Road
0:55 - Simple Key #3 - Songclave
1:33 - Simple Key #4 - Sands of Karak
1:52 - Simple Lock #1 - Mosshome
2:16 - Simple Lock #2 - Deep Docks
2:32 - Simple Lock #3 - Sinner’s Road
2:48 - Simple Lock #4 - High Halls
title: Hollow Knight: Silksong Simple Key Guide | How to Find All Simple Keys and Their Locks

author: IGN
description:
From space ninjas to light guardians to killer crabs, these are the very best looter shooters around. 

Despite being one of the more recognizable sub-genres in gaming, you may be surprised by just how precious few looter shooter games there actually are. Putting together a list of the best of them revealed how rare a truly brilliant one is, presumably a result of how incredibly hard they are to make, and their unfortunate tendency to go the way of Anthem or Suicide Squad: Kill The Justice League – cut short after failing to grab an audience. But what they lack in quantity, they more than make up for in just how many hours you can lose to them, and over the past nearly two decades, we've spent more time with this genre than we'd care to admit.

From Destiny, to The Division and all the games in the Borderlands series, here are our top 14 looter shooters.

#IGN #Gaming
title: The 14 Best Looter Shooter Games, Ranked

author: IGN

Players will venture off into a shared open world to loot, battle, craft, and more in an unforgiving future Earth. Raiders can soon partake in the upcoming Server Slam from October 17 through October 19, completely free with no registration required on consoles and PC. ARC Raiders is launching on October 30 for PlayStation 5 (PS5), Xbox Series X|S, and PC (Steam and Epic Games Store).

author: IGN

Don't miss the Features Trailer for Ghost of Yotei, the upcoming action-adventure game and sequel to Ghost of Tsushima, developed by Sucker Punch Productions. Players will embark on a journey of revenge as Atsu across feudal Japan with PS5-specific features. 4K resolution, DualSense Haptic Feedback, Adaptive Triggers, 3D Audio, and more can all be enjoyed through the power of the PlayStation 5. author: IGN
description:
Take a tour of the K'un-Lun: Heart of Heaven map in this latest Marvel Rivals trailer for the superhero team-based PVP shooter game. K'un-Lun: Heart of Heaven is coming to Marvel Rivals on September 25 at 9 AM UTC.

As the Timestream Entanglement spreads throughout different dimensions, the mystical city of K'un-Lun was certainly no exception. Time trickles by in this land riddled with ancient Chinese architecture, but something is amiss. The Immortal Dragon and protector of the city, Shou-Lao, has slipped into an eternal slumber, leaving K'un-Lun vulnerable and facing conflicts like never before. 

With K'un-Lun on the brink of exposure, Doctor Doom schemes to seize the Heart of Shou-Lao. Iron Fist now leads his people to defend their homeland, but awakening Shou-Lao comes with its risks.

#MarvelRivals #Gaming #IGN
title: Marvel Rivals - Official K'un-Lun: Heart of Heaven Map Reveal Trailer

In Good Fortune, a well-meaning but rather inept angel named Gabriel (Keanu Reeves) meddles in the lives of a struggling gig worker (Aziz Ansari) and a wealthy venture capitalist (Seth Rogen).

Good Fortune opens in theaters on October 17, 2025.

author: IGN
description:
Meet Joe Higashi and see the character in action in this latest Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves trailer for the fighting game. Joe Higashi will be voiced by Kevin Andrew Rivera (EN) and Kozo Mito (JA). Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves is available now on PlayStation 5 (PS5), PlayStation 4 (PS4), Xbox Series X/S, and PC (Steam and Epic Games Store). Joe Higashi joins the Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves fighting game roster in fall 2025.

Muay Thai champion Joe Higashi debuted alongside fellow heroes Terry and Andy Bogard in the series' first entry, FATAL FURY (1991), solidifying their status as faces of the franchise for generations. Now, 26 years after his last roster appearance (1999's FATAL FURY: WILD AMBITION), Joe makes his triumphant return as a playable character! Buckle up as the Summoner of Storms sweeps through South Town once more in Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves!

#IGN #gaming
title: Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves - Official Joe Higashi Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Silent Hill f reviewed by Tristan Ogilvie on PlayStation 5. Also available on Xbox Series X|S and PC.

"Silent Hill f serves up a fresh new Japanese setting to explore, a fascinatingly dark story to unravel, and plenty of twisted freaks to torment you with. All of that made me wish I was a bit more enamoured with a combat system that early on seems like too much of a chore to be fun, yet eventually made me feel too overpowered at times to be consistently scared. I admire developer Neobards Entertainment for taking a big swing here, but like a laboured lurch from Hinako’s frustratingly fragile lead pipe it just hasn’t quite landed exactly where I’d like it to. Still, some spectacular art design, imaginative puzzles, and a compelling lead character means this latest mainline entry in Konami’s seminal survival horror series definitely earns a grade higher than a Silent Hill F; it’s probably closer to a Silent Hill B-."
title: Silent Hill f Review
